world_modeler.goal: Extract and normalize the action schemata, predicates, and their causal semantics from the public description without emitting PDDL. Produce a compact, machine-usable operator model for downstream components.

symbol_mapper.goal: Unify naming and resolve any aliasing or potential ambiguities across predicates, objects, and actions (e.g., consistent casing, argument ordering) so that later stages operate on a canonical symbol set. Do not emit PDDL.

grounder.goal: Enumerate objects, ground initial states and goals for both scenarios, and structure them as problem instances tied to the canonicalized symbols. Do not emit PDDL.

private_information: You are responsible for temporal and causal auditing.
Eliminate bookkeeping shortcuts such as artificial quotas or post-hoc penalties.
Check plan A against preconditions and effects step-by-step; derive causal links and ordering constraints.
Identify any precondition threats or missing support and summarize actionable fixes for planning.
consistency_auditor.goal: Audit temporal/causal consistency of the modeled operators and instances. Validate Scenario A’s provided plan and synthesize minimal ordering and support constraints that help solve Scenario B. Do not emit PDDL.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate all upstream outputs to produce a final PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files (Scenario A and Scenario B) suitable for the FastDownward solver.

public_information: Operators (parameter order is (object_0 object_1 object_2 [object_3]) as applicable):
Paltry: preconditions { hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2 }; add { next o0 o2 }; del { vase o0 o1 }.
Sip: preconditions { hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2 }; add { vase o0 o1 }; del { next o0 o2 }.
Clip: preconditions { hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2 }; add { vase o0 o1 }; del { next o0 o2 }.
Wretched: preconditions { sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3 }; add { next o0 o2 }; del { next o0 o1 }.
Memory: preconditions { cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1 }; add { next o0 o2 }; del { next o0 o1 }.
Tightfisted: preconditions { hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1 }; add { next o0 o2 }; del { vase o0 o1 }.

clip object_11 object_4 object_10; wretched object_3 object_7 object_6 object_1; clip object_12 object_3 object_6; wretched object_3 object_6 object_5 object_1; tightfisted object_12 object_3 object_5; wretched object_4 object_10 object_8 object_2; tightfisted object_11 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_9 object_2; clip object_13 object_4 object_9; wretched object_4 object_9 object_10 object_2; tightfisted object_13 object_4 object_10; memory object_0 object_8 object_5; sip object_12 object_0 object_5; memory object_0 object_5 object_8; paltry object_12 object_0 object_8.

model_actions.system_prompt: You transform the public operator descriptions into a concise, normalized operator model. Do not emit PDDL. Return a compact structured description that includes: predicates list and, for each action, (name, parameters [o0 o1 o2 (o3?)], preconditions, add_effects, del_effects). Use only symbols appearing in the public information.
model_actions.prompt: You are world_modeler. Use the public information to extract predicates and action schemata with their preconditions and effects. Normalize naming consistently (e.g., Paltry, Sip, Clip, Wretched, Memory, Tightfisted) and retain argument positions as described. Output a minimal machine-readable summary under keys {predicates, actions}.

resolve_symbols.system_prompt: You unify and canonicalize symbols from upstream. Do not emit PDDL. Ensure actions, predicates, and argument orders are consistent and resolve casing (e.g., treat operator names canonically). Provide a mapping report and the canonicalized operator model.
resolve_symbols.prompt: You are symbol_mapper. Given the action_schemas, produce (1) a symbol normalization table for actions and predicates, (2) the canonicalized operator model suitable for grounding, and (3) notes on any potential aliasing or ambiguity.

extract_instances.system_prompt: You assemble objects and ground instance data for each scenario. Do not emit PDDL. Return an object list and, for each scenario, sets of initial facts and goals using the canonical symbols.
extract_instances.prompt: You are grounder. Use the canonicalized model and the public scenario facts to return: objects = [object_0..object_13], scenario_a = {init: [...], goal: [...]}, scenario_b = {init: [...], goal: [...]}. Preserve only facts and goals described in the public information.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal/causal consistency. Do not emit PDDL. Validate Scenario A’s provided plan against preconditions/effects step-by-step; produce causal links, ordering constraints, and identify threats or unsupported preconditions. Remove bookkeeping shortcuts (e.g., quotas, post-hoc penalties) and return only grounded causal reasoning.
audit.prompt: You are consistency_auditor. Using the canonical operators and the grounded instances, (1) verify Scenario A’s plan is or is not valid with detailed justification per step, (2) output minimal ordering and support constraints that make the plan valid (or explain violations), and (3) extract reusable causal patterns to guide planning for Scenario B. Summarize any required invariants.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in planning. Produce a final PDDL domain and two PDDL problems (Scenario A and Scenario B) suitable for the FastDownward solver. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use only predicates and actions from the canonicalized operator model. Ensure STRIPS-compatible definitions with add and delete effects. For Scenario A and Scenario B, instantiate objects object_0..object_13, include only facts given as initial conditions, and encode the goals exactly as specified. If the audit reveals inconsistencies, resolve them in the problem encodings without inventing new predicates; preserve operator semantics. Include action preconditions and effects faithfully as in the description.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the canonical operators, grounded instances, and the audit findings to emit a single-agent PDDL domain and two problems targeting FastDownward. Name the domain mystery-blocks-domain. Name the problems scenario-a and scenario-b. Ensure all objects are declared and all initial facts and goals match the public information. Do not include extraneous metrics or costs.
